CustomField.description: Term Use The debt service coverage ratio, also known as "debt coverage ratio", is the ratio of cash available for debt servicing to interest, principal and lease payments. It is a popular benchmark used in the measurement of an entity's ability to produce enough cash to cover its debt payments.
CustomField.inlineHelpText: Minimum Debt Service Coverage Ratio. Formula is the NOI divided by the annual debt service (principal, interest, etc.). Most lenders, including CoreVest, require a DSCR of 1.20x, if a DSCR is 1.0x, this means that 100% of the NOI covers the loan amount
CustomField.label: Min DSCR
